intro: Scutellaria violacea var. sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim blue skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces striking violet to blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes, often found in forest understories or rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and studied for its pharmacological properties.
